title.native: ボボボーボ・ボーボボ

description:
Bo Bobo is a man with the incredible power of hearing the voices of hair and using his own to fight. He uses his power to fight off the Margarita Empire and all of Emperor Tsuru Tsuruiina's minions who are stealing the hair off of anyone they find to power up their emperor.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Dissociative Identities
tags.description: A case where one or more people share the same body.

tags.name: Martial Arts
tags.description: Centers around the use of traditional hand-to-hand combat.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

node.description: Previously working at Tavac, now for Real-T.

Hiroko & Miyake on vocals.  mihimaru GT is a two-person group signed with the major record label Universal Music Japan. Made up of composer, lyricist, and vocalist Miyake and vocalist/lyricist Hiroko, the duet have tried their hand at fusing an urban sound with more traditional J-pop elements.  (Source: jame-world)

Shibata is a japanese animator and animatior director currently working at Toei Animation. He is the father of the mangaka [Yuusaku Shibata](https://anilist.co/staff/107002) and [Hikari Shibata](https://anilist.co/staff/127324).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E4%BA%80%E5%B1%B1%E8%80%95%E4%B8%80%E9%83%8E)

Kouichirou Kameyama is a composer and arranger.

JINDOU was a rock band formed in 1997 and disbanded on December 4, 2005.
Members:     
Miyashita Masaya (宮下昌也) - Vocalist & Guitarist
Miyashita Koji (宮下浩司) - Guitarist
Nagata Masaki (永田雅規) - Rapper
Ono Takeshi (小野武司) - Rapper
